name: Xyphus
description: Xyphus is a role-playing video game first released in 1984. The game was designed by Skip Waller and Dave Albert, with a Macintosh version by Bob Hardy, for Penguin Software. It was the first RPG on Macintosh. It featured upgraded graphics and a mouse friendly user-interface; an improvement over the Apple II and Commodore 64 releases. Xyphus is pronounced, Eks-see-foose, and is the Greek word for sword.
